channel.title: BBC News - Technology

item.title: Amazon and Nike exploring Peloton takeover, reports say
item.description: The exercise equipment maker's shares have slumped in recent months as it faced a number of challenges.

item.title: Tech giants targeted in harmful content crackdown
item.description: Sending genuinely harmful communications will become illegal if the bill becomes law.

item.title: North Korea: Missile programme funded through stolen crypto, UN report says
item.description: Investigators say cyber-attackers stole over $50 million in digital assets between 2020 and mid-2021.

item.title: Meta moves to tackle creepy behaviour in virtual reality
item.description: Women describe their experiences but what can firms behind virtual-reality platforms do about it?

item.title: Facebook owner Meta sees biggest ever stock market loss
item.description: The company's chief executive Mark Zuckerberg saw his personal fortune fall by $31bn.

item.title: European oil facilities hit by cyber-attacks
item.description: Multiple oil transport and storage companies across Europe have been hacked, the BBC has confirmed.

item.title: KP Snacks hack prompts crisp and nut supplies warning
item.description: The producer of McCoys, Hula Hoops and various varieties of nuts, is hit by a ransomware attack

item.title: Koo: India's Twitter alternative with global ambitions
item.description: India's Koo expects to surpass Twitter's 25 million-strong user base in the country.

item.title: Jeff Bezos' superyacht will see historic bridge dismantled
item.description: Rotterdam says the world's richest man will foot the bill to remove part of the historic bridge.

item.title: Wordle code could be copied to play for seven years
item.description: But anyone tempted might need a degree of coding know-how and there could be legal issues.

item.title: Havana Syndrome may be caused by ‘directed energy’
item.description: A new intelligence report provides another twist in the long-running mystery of US officials falling sick.

item.title: Facebook: Daily active users fall for first time in 18-year history
item.description: The technology giant's owner Meta said platforms like TikTok were hurting its growth.

item.title: Spotify boss says too early to know Joe Rogan row impact
item.description: Shares in the streaming platform fell by more than 10% in after-hours trading.

item.title: Mental health helpline ends data-sharing relationship
item.description: Crisis Text Line shared anonymised data with an AI firm but ends the relationship after backlash.

item.title: New 2030 target set for nationwide 1Gbps broadband
item.description: The date, five years later than first promised, is announced in the government's Levelling Up White Paper.

item.title: Andrew Forrest: Australian billionaire launches criminal case against Facebook
item.description: In a world-first case in Australia, Andrew Forrest takes aim at scam ads that used his image.

item.title: DeepMind AI rivals average human competitive coder
item.description: After simulating 10 contests, with more than 5,000 participants, AlphaCode has ranks in the top 54%.

item.title: Tesla recalls cars that may roll past stop signs
item.description: The firm will disable a feature in its self-driving software that lets them slow down but not stop.

item.title: What next for Wordle and its fans?
item.description: Fans have been left guessing what will come next, as the viral puzzle is sold to the New York Times.

item.title: Supermarket cameras to guess age of alcohol buyers
item.description: Major chains begin testing automated age-verification, to avoid the wait for staff at self-checkouts.

item.title: Joe Rogan: White House praises Spotify's new Covid disclaimers
item.description: The administration says it believes tech giants should do more to fight misinformation.

item.title: India says it will launch digital rupee as soon as this year
item.description: It is the latest major economy to announce its own virtual currency, as China trials the digital yuan.

item.title: FBI urges temporary phones for Olympic athletes
item.description: The new advice comes ahead of the Winter Olympics in Beijing.

item.title: Cyber-attack strikes German fuel supplies
item.description: Reports suggest loading and unloading systems are paralysed but extent of the issue is not yet known.

item.title: Facebook-funded cryptocurrency Diem winds down
item.description: Assets of the cryptocurrency project, launched two-and-a-half years ago as Libra, are sold.

item.title: Wordle inventor 'overwhelmed' as New York Times buys game
item.description: Briton Josh Wardle sells his online game sensation to the New York Times for a seven-figure sum.

item.title: Sony to buy Destiny developer Bungie for $3.6bn
item.description: It comes after Microsoft revealed plans to buy Activision Blizzard in the largest ever gaming deal.

item.title: Global chip shortage: Jaguar Land Rover loses £9m
item.description: The UK-based car maker warned that it expects the chip shortage to continue throughout this year.

item.title: Joe Rogan pledges to try harder after Neil Young Spotify row
item.description: The podcaster supports the streaming giant's move to add warnings to podcasts discussing Covid-19.

item.title: Click News: A round-up of the week's tech news
item.description: LJ Rich looks at some of the week's best technology stories.

item.title: Can tech help make us better football players?
item.description: Omar Mehtab tries the wearable tech used by professionals which is now offered as consumer versions.

item.title: Inside Kazakhstan's giant crypto-mine
item.description: Kazakhstan is now the world's second biggest crypto-currency mining country, thanks partly to a vast mine in the desert.

item.title: Shang-Chi: How we brought realism to the film’s dragons
item.description: WetaFX's visual effects and animation supervisors explain the challenges of making the film.

item.title: Hearing balls bounce at Australian Open and other tech news
item.description: LJ Rich looks at the best of the week's technology news stories.

item.title: The airport tech helping to prevent delayed flights
item.description: Surveillance software and face ID systems can speed up airports, but at what cost?

item.title: From bike lanes to lost pets - the Nextdoor network
item.description: Chief executive Sarah Friar explains how the pandemic has affected the ultra-local social channel.

item.title: How to store excess wind power underwater
item.description: A Dutch company is testing an underwater system that can store excess energy from wind farms.

item.title: Why cows may be hiding something but AI can spot it
item.description: Farmers are using artificial intelligence to spot lameness in their herd before it gets serious.

item.title: The scramble for cargo aircraft as shipping costs soar
item.description: Cargo aircraft are being rushed into service amid a worldwide shortage in shipping capacity.

item.title: Instagram and Whatsapp stalker's lies 'ruined my life for years'
item.description: Women who were targeted by Matthew Hardy speak about the impact of his avalanche of messages.

item.title: AI: Why chefs are turning to artificial intelligence
item.description: How a robot is being used in the highly specialised business of creating flavours.

item.title: The people deciding to ditch their smartphones
item.description: The smartphone users who are ditching their handsets to take back more control of their lives.

item.title: Like a drone that you sit in – but would you feel safe?
item.description: Personal drones that can transport one or two passengers will soon be available for anyone to buy.

item.title: Facebook Messenger: The battle over end-to-end encryption
item.description: The battle-lines have been drawn - but what is end-to-end encryption and why is it controversial?

item.title: 5G phones: How serious is the threat to US flights?
item.description: Ten leading US airlines are warning that the expansion of 5G services could be disastrous.

item.title: How Nigeria succeeded in clipping Twitter's wings
item.description: Some fear that Twitter agreeing to new rules in Nigeria may encourage others to restrict social media.

item.title: What can we do to get more women into coding?
item.description: How visual, auditory and kinesthetic tools used to teach kids coding should be adapted for adults.

item.title: How delivery apps created 'the Netflix of food ordering'
item.description: Innovative food delivery apps offer everything from multiple restaurant orders to home chef cuisine.

item.title: The controversy of wood pellets as a green energy source
item.description: Wood pellets are touted as a 'green' way to make electricity, but many reject these claims.

item.title: The AI software that could turn you in to a music star
item.description: Artificial intelligence is now smart enough to write tracks that earn streaming service royalties.

item.title: The companies offering delivery to the Moon
item.description: Intuitive Machines and its rivals hope to make the first US moon landings since Apollo 17 in 1972.

item.title: CES: Should the world’s biggest tech show have gone ahead?
item.description: The annual Consumer Electronics Show (CES) has gone ahead in Las Vegas, despite the pandemic.

item.title: Elizabeth Holmes: Has the Theranos scandal changed Silicon Valley?
item.description: Could a Theranos scandal happen again or has Silicon Valley learnt its lesson?

item.title: Miners experiment with hydrogen to power giant trucks
item.description: Anglo American is testing a hydrogen-powered giant truck in a bid to make its business greener.
